value.name: SNP government launches 10th paper on Scottish independence on GROUNDHOG DAY - as report claims breakaway effort would lead to free-to-air sporting events and Eurovision entries
value.description: The SNP government have released a tenth paper on Scottish independence - on Groundhog Day. The report outlined plans for free-to-air sporting events, Eurovision entries and a bid to rejoin the European Union.

value.name: Nicola Sturgeon's Covid Inquiry session showed up Scotland's media
value.description: SCOTLAND is very poorly served by its media, the broadcast media is controlled from London and pursues an avowedly British political and

value.name: SNP’s Covid protection for vulnerable ‘afterthought’ could have cost 1,000 lives
value.description: Government advisor Prof Mark Woolhouse makes claim at Covid Inquiry as he criticises ‘glaring weakness’ of shielding policy

value.name: Scottish civil servants accused of ‘going native’ in support of SNP
value.description: Scotland’s most senior mandarin has been urged to launch an investigation into his civil servants “going native” in support of the SNP in the wake of “alarming” evidence presented to the UK Covid Inquiry.

value.name: Alex Salmond hosts new talk show on Turkish public broadcaster
value.description: The move comes after the former Scottish first minister suspended his programme on Russian state broadcaster RT in 2022.

value.name: Permanent closure of harbour berth 'hammer blow' for island residents
value.description: The Irish berth at Ardrossan Harbour is to shut permanently in what is being described as a ‘hammer blow’ for island residents. The berth, used by Calmac since May instead of the harbour’s primary Arran berth, is the only dock the catamaran MV Alfred can use to cross over to the island.

value.name: Scottish licence fee expected to pay for new broadcaster under independence vision
value.description: A new Scottish licence fee would be created under new plans to shake up the broadcasting landscape in an independent Scotland.The Scottish Government said its proposed public sector broadcaster would “better reflect and prioritise the specific needs and interests of Scottish audiences".

value.name: Labour not committed to ‘arbitrary’ numbers on green investment – Rayner
value.description: Labour deputy leader Angela Rayner has said the party is not committed to “arbitrary” numbers on its pledge to ultimately invest £28 billion a year in the green economy. She said the money will depend on sticking to fiscal rules and Labour will “ramp up” to this figure if in government.

value.name: SNP government launches 10th paper on Scottish independence on GROUNDHOG DAY - as report claims breakaway effort would lead to free-to-air sporting events and Eurovision entries
value.description: There was a sense of deja vu today as a 10th independence paper was released by the SNP government. It revealed aims to show Scotland matches, join Eurovision and leave the EU.

value.name: Minute's silence held as tributes paid to former West Lothian depute Provost
value.description: One time Labour councillor Allister Mackie was a champion of workers' rights, local democracy and the poetry of Robert Burns. He was a man who made Bathgate his home but who's roots stayed in Kilmarno

She said the money will depend on sticking to fiscal rules and Labour will “ramp up” to this figure if in government.

value.name: Alex Salmond to host new 'really fun' chat show on Turkish TV station
value.description: Alex Salmond will host a new "really fun" chat show on Turkish public broadcaster TRT World. The former SNP leader announced today he would be joined by Succession star Brian Cox as his first guest.

value.name: Renfrew road left in 'floods of water' after burst pipe
value.description: A main road in Renfrew has been left in floods of water after claims of a burst pipe. The incident was flagged by SNP Councillor John Shaw who said that he was contacted by a constituent about the problem on Ferry Road.

value.name: Angela Rayner challenged on bankers' bonuses and benefit caps on Scottish visit
value.description: The SNP issued the challenge as Rayner visits East Lothian in Scotland, an area the party said is home to 1600 children “impacted by the callous two-child cap and rape clause”. Labour have been fire-fighting since shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves told ...

value.name: Alex Salmond to feature in new 'really fun' interview series for Turkish broadcaster TRT World
value.description: Former first minister Alex Salmond has agreed to the interview series with the Turkish broadcaster, despite criticism of his previous show on Russia’s RT channel

video.name: Alex Salmond to feature in new 'really fun' interview series for Turkish broadcaster TRT World

value.name: SNP tries to bribe Scots to back independence with free football on TV: Nats reveal plan to set up national broadcaster with right to show country's World Cup qualifiers ...
value.description: Angus Robertson outlined plans to set up a national broadcaster if the country leaves the UK, which would be given the legal right to show World Cup and European Championship qualifiers.

value.name: More Misery For Rishi Sunak As Poll Suggests Tories Could Win Fewer Than 100 Seats
value.description: Labour would win 484, up 287 on four years ago. The Lib Dems - who are on 10% in the poll - would see their number of seats quadruple from 8 to 34, while the SNP would fall from 48 to 18. That would hand Labour an overall majority of more than 200 seats.

value.name: Scottish Water charges are going up: What you'll pay in Barrhead
value.description: Water bills will rise by 8.8% for homes in Barrhead from April. The Scottish Water charge is added to council tax bills, so despite a freeze in the local authority charge, people’s overall bills will be higher than last year. Scottish Water said the rise is necessary to carry out investment in the network.

value.name: MSP demands SNP answers for Inverclyde Covid bereaved
value.description: Greenock-born West Scotland Conservative Jamie Greene has hit out at what he has called the 'culture of secrecy' within the SNP and at Holyrood. Mr Greene, in a speech to parliament this week, accused the party of a lack of transparency in its decision ...

value.name: Nicola Sturgeon worked 'day and night' during covid 'to make the best decisions'
value.description: Nicola Sturgeon worked "day and night to make the best decisions" during the coronavirus pandemic, a senior SNP minister has said. Angus Robertson defended his former boss today following her high-profile appearance at the UK Covid Inquiry on Wednesday.
